data.text: Cannondale Topstone Bikes: Are They Worth the Money?

**Why are Cannondale Topstone Bikes so expensive? Is it worth it? **Hello, Just comparing these two "Gravel" bikes here (Triban Rc120) and wondering why anyone would pay extra $1000 for the topstone 4 base model. The two bikes have the exact same disk brakes (promax 330r) , microshift components (r8(2x8) vs 1x10 Advent X. Similar frame geometry and a carbon forks for both. Can just swap out the tires on Triban and save a ton of money. What is the Cannondale providing that makes it way more worth it then the Triban? Is it the frame? I know topstone has 2-4 more mm of clearance (38mm vs 43mm maximums) however that doesnt seem to make it worth the extra $1000. What am I missing here? Is it really just the brand name factor doubling the price? [https://www.cannondale.com/en-ca/bikes/road/gravel/topstone-alloy/topstone-4](https://www.cannondale.com/en-ca/bikes/road/gravel/topstone-alloy/topstone-4) [https://www.decathlon.ca/en/endurance-road-bikes/326838-81472-rc120-disc-brake-bike.html](https://www.decathlon.ca/en/endurance-road-bikes/326838-81472-rc120-disc-brake-bike.html) [https://www.decathlon.com/products/gravel-bike-bicycle](https://www.decathlon.com/products/gravel-bike-bicycle) Thanks!

data.text: Yeah, I wouldn't be buying dept store or supermarket bikes. On first glance, it looks like the Topstone is ~3lbs lighter. Cannondale has been making amazing aluminum frames for so many years - the Topstone is most assuredly better engineered, lighter and stronger. You can make the decision for yourself - but also buying a bike at a bike shop gets you support. If it's a warranty issue, they will get the parts from the manufacturer and fix it. Big box stores really just sell disposable bikes with no support.

data.text: The Triban is 900, while the TopStone is only 1360. The brakes on both use the same pads; not a whole lot of braking surface. Both have an alloy frame and carbon fork, but the Triban has more mounting points for touring or longer distance riding. The Topstone features more aggressive tires and an upgraded crank. My reccomendation, buy the Triban, use the savings to buy better tires and brakes that arent 'economic' (crap). The triban seems to be the better investment, as both are entry level models.
